name: NewYorker
text: The policies in Joe Biden's climate plan provide a good roadmap by which to steer, even if that map avoids the most controversial areas of the debate, @BillMcKibben writes. https://t.co/Ko4mcjzrBa

name: NewYorker
text: Sarah Longwell has raised and spent millions of dollars on ads advocating for President Trump’s removal from office and encouraging other disaffected Republicans to take action. Is there any hope for the movement to which she’s devoted herself? https://t.co/AnYu6CdDcJ

name: NewYorker
text: We should be asking not whether colleges should get their tuition dollars by putting students, faculty, and staff at risk but how to insure that college students will be able to learn in a meaningful way. https://t.co/QptquMeZ54

name: NewYorker
text: “The ﬁrst time she saw punks, it was amazing, like being electrocuted, jolted out of her dead skin.” Read an excerpt from @harikunzru’s forthcoming novel. https://t.co/HUPgPdyVwh

name: NewYorker
text: One social worker's account of a weekend of unrest in Atlanta, leading up to the charges against Atlanta police. "One police officer used his car as a battering ram," he says. "He hit at least five protesters point-blank." https://t.co/RASINY8Ff6

name: NewYorker
text: Richard Horton has become one of the sharpest critics of the public-health response to the pandemic in Britain, the United States, and other nations whose governments have failed their populations. https://t.co/2uX9kOVEOJ

text: Fiction by Milan Kundera: “He was gentle and intelligent like his father; and he would always be an intruder, as his mother had viewed him.” https://t.co/KwLxahtfKL
